intro: Acetosella melilotoides, commonly known as the woolly mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas. Its leaves are oval to lance-shaped, and the flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Acetosella melilotoides is also used in some traditional herbal remedies for its purported medicinal properties.
